qas.question: Who helps out a wrestler with poor speaking abilities?
Who else can perform the manager role?
Who might participate in a love triangle story?

context: In some cases a wrestler may possess admirable physical traits but perceived mediocre public speaking abilities (such as Brock Lesnar), or their gimmick may be that of a "wild savage" needing a handler (such as Kamala). Such performers have historically employed a <a0_0>manager<a0_0/>, who speaks on their behalf and adds to the performance. Managers have sometimes <a1_0>become major personalities<a1_0/>, including Bobby Heenan, Paul Heyman, Ernie Roth, and Paul Bearer. A manager role may also be filled by a <a2_0>"valet<a2_0/>", typically <a3_0>an appealing female<a3_0/> who may participate in love triangle storylines, "damsel in distress" situations, and scripted fights with female wrestlers. Some of these have also gone on to become recognized stars, such as Tammy Lynn Sytch, Stacy Keibler, and Miss Elizabeth.
